title: How long does it take to get Canadian Permanent Residence? - Quora

response.answer_text: If one is interested to immigrate to Canada as PR under express entry program, it would take around 9–16 months depending on which stage you are right now. It takes 1–2 months to take IELTS dates, specially now that everyone is interested to move to Australia/Canada, getting test dates is difficult. It takes around 1–2 months to get education assessment done which you can do in parallel with IELTS preparation. You also need to gather letter of reference from your all you employers which would take at least 1–2 months as large organizations are slow in issuing such letters , some might not even provide letters so you have to arrange for an affidavit. Getting police clearance from all countries where you have stayed for 6+ months, if stayed in USA for 6+ months count atleast 6–8 weeks to get police clearance. In india if you passport address is same as your current residential address you will get PCC in a day else it takes 1 month. Arranging proof of funds from bank would take 1 week depending up if you have sufficient balance or need to liquidate some investments. Once you have good score in IELTS and your CRS is high enough to get an ITA, you will have 60 days to submit your application. Ideally if all documents are ready then it should take max 2 weeks to submit application. Once the application is submitted then it is processed in 6 months time , some applications may take longer. If you account all of these times then it would take 9–16 months.

You’ve got it backwards. You have to be invited to become a permanent resident of Canada BEFORE you arrive in Canada. There is no mechanism by which you can arrive on a visitor visa and then simply stay and magically become a permanent resident. You must apply in advance from your own country. The process can take up to 5 years to complete and you must score enough points based on things like education, age, specialized skills, etc. You must pass a background check, you must pass a medical and you must prove that you have the necessary financial resources. If you get through all that, you can be invited to become a permanent resident of Canada. If you do come here on a visitor visa and overstay or get caught working or looking for work or something else that you are not permitted to do on a visitor visa, you will be arrested, held in jail, deported, banned from returning for 5 years and stand almost no chance of ever getting another visa again.

If you are in the way to sponsor parents and grandparents for a Permanent Residence, think in a long term and no less than 2000 UDS (medical examinations, paperwork, courriers, translations). The time, cost and procedures depend on each case. All family members must pass medical tests even if they are not included in the application (parents, siblings). If any of the applicants have an illness that can cost more than 6,600 CAD per annum, you must file an alleged (fairness letter) very well documented because otherwise all will be rejected. If your family is looking to live in Quebec, you need to apply for an additional permit from the province. The sponsorship of the wife or common law partner (unmarried) is simpler (a year or less). Study the official immigration website and forums where other people ask specific questions and tell their experiences.

It can take from 6 months to over a year depending upon how quick you are in completing processes/filling forms/arranging documents etc. I would not do justice to this question if I answer it in one line. So please keep reading. In this process, there are many documents which you need to submit, some of them are internal (ex. those which are readily available with you - like mark sheets, passport copy etc) and some are external (which you will have to arrange - like education transcripts, Police clearance certificate etc.) Also there are processes which take their own time - like getting a medical test done, which depends how soon you get appointment in the hospital. If you are good at multi-tasking and are determined to get things done quickly, (and most importantly - qualifying to apply for PR), you can complete the PR process within 7–8 months.

Hello, You don’t have to spend a specific amount of time in Canada to be considered eligible for Permanent Residence. In fact, many individuals need to apply for temporary status before they can spend any time in Canada at all. Depending on which country you come from, you may apply for a Visitor Visa that will allow you to stay in Canada for up to 6 months at a time. This is an option if you would like to visit and travel in Canada before deciding to apply for a work permit, study permit, or Permanent Residency. In order to apply for Permanent Residency, you must meet the eligibility requirements for the program you apply to. To maintain PR status, you must also stay in Canada for a certain amount of time in every 5 year period. I hope this helps clarify any confusion you may have. Best of luck, Jade Calver, RCIC Calver & Associates Canadian Immigration Services

I recently got my PR and after I got ITA and submitted ALL documents, I had to wait 4 months before the decision status changed to “Approved”. Also add in the time it takes for you to book and give your IELTS exam, collect all necessary documentation, book and give your medical exam etc. For me this must have been around 3–4 months of after hours work. I would guess anywhere between 6 - 9 months everything included. I have heard it also depends slightly on your score, example a person with 1100 score will get their application approved a lot faster than someone who just clears the threshold; although I don’t know this for certain.

Processing times vary.  The immigration department has published processing times at Check application processing times  .  The most charitable interpretation of the processing times listed is that they refer to straightforward cases where there are no issues with admissibility  to Canada; if admissibility to Canada is at issue, then delays are common.  In the case of family class applications, the timeframes listed are often exaggerated in processing length to discourage applicants from making premature inquiries about the status of those applications.

It depends greatly on the immigration category in which your application is based under, which visa office your application goes to, (at least in my case) and whether or not there are any issues, such as criminality, medical, etc.... In my case, I had to wait 11 months, starting from when I sent in my application, to when I received my Confirmation of Permanent Residence in the mail. That was through the Family Class - Outside Canada category. The best place to figure out average wait times for immigration, is at the CIC website. Check application processing times

It depends upon the program you choose to immigrate but generally if you apply through Express Entry, I’m assuming you get the ITA and submitted your application then it shouldn’t take more than 4 months. Some people are getting the PR in a month. Here’re are different pathways to get Canadian PR, It might helps you to find out the right pathway.

Hi Abhinav, The way, Canada Express Entry  program is going on, it is very difficult to predict. I know, most of the consultant with say 6 to 8 months. In my view, it is  wrong unless someone is getting CRS score of more than 40 points. Since Jan 2015, CIC is short-listing only those applications where  applicant is having  CRS score of 450+. Unfortunately, most of the applicants are ranging from 300 to 375. In brief, a a very long time

The timelines vary depending on your credentials and points scored. The Canadian Immigration department publishes average timelines on their websites. Take alook at the timelines.There is no need to employ any consultant as it will be a waste of time and money. The consultants do not speed the process, they simply collect the information from you and prepare your application and send it to the Canadian High Commission/Consulate in your country. The collect lots of money as fees etc.You can handle the application and interview process yourself. If you want to know more information, then ask Quora.Good luck.

Hi, It can take anything between 12 to 14 months if not sooner, depending on your CRS score and the other factors like: Your IELTS Score.Educational Credentials/Documentation in Order and Assessed by an approved Assessment Agency.Proof of Funds.Police Clearance Certificate.Medical Test Results.Existing Job Offer from a Canadian Employer.Hope this helps.

From one to five YEARS. The whole immigration process is on a self-serve basis. Start here. Do you want to come to Canada, or extend your stay? It costs about CAD 2,000 for the process. In addition, you need to prove you have CAD 12,300 of your own money when you get the visa, much more for a family. All immigrants must be able to pay for themselves when they arrive.

It seems that you want to ask “How long does it take to get permanent residency in Australia from India?” So, if you are a skilled worker who is interested in becoming the permanent resident of Australia, you can find the processing times for the skilled migration visa categories below. For subclass 189Subclass 189 is a skilled independent visa that follows a point-based system, the processing time for which is generally 8 to 11 months. It can be said that 75 % of the applications gets processed in 8 months and the 90% of the applications gets processed in 11 months. For subclass 190190 is a state sponsored visa category that is also based on a point-based system. The DHA processes 75% of the 190 visa applications in 8-9 months and 90% of the applications in 10-11 months. For subclass 491491 visa is a skilled work regional (provisional) visa and is not a permanent visa, however it paves the way for you to get Australian PR without any hitch. Under this category, 75% of the applications gets processed in 7 months, while 90% of the applications gets processed within 9 months. I hope that this information might be useful for you! Well, the above is not the exact time, it’s just an estimate! Processing times might increase due to some circumstances such as incomplete application and documents and many more. Good Luck!
Just living in Canada never makes you a permanent resident. You have to apply for permanent residency and be approved for it by Immigration Canada.
You need to physically live in Canada for a minimum of 3 years out of the 5 years post-PR.
It depends on your case, timelines vary from case to case. For updated timings please review CIC website. Check application processing times
If you come to Canada as a visitor you may stay for up to six months, however this does not in any way help you if you wish to immigrate.
If you have a student visa or a PVT; which is a work visa, you can stay until the end of your visa at which time you will be offered a Permanent Residency.
You would need to apply. Google Canadian Immigration, and get the information directly from the government agency that is responsible.
You are eligible to become a Canadian Citizen if you have lived in Canada for 3 out of the last 5 years.
How long does it take to get Canadian Permanent Residence? Please try: CIC how long to get a PR for Singaporean
If you are playing in the NHL, then only for one season. For everyone else: Apply for citizenship: Who can apply

You can apply from Express Entry and can get PR without stepping foot in Canada. You need to spend 2 years out of 5 to keep that PR though. If you manage 3 years stay in 5 years, you can get citizenship there.
19 Months Maximum including getting your passport.
Check with Canadian consulate
Normally it will take around 6-9 months!
